title: Public transport for the Western Bulldogs vs Brisbane Lions AFL match in Ballarat: Saturday 10 April 2021
articleContent:
Public transport for the Western Bulldogs vs Brisbane Lions AFL match in Ballarat: Saturday 10 April 2021

Events > Sport

Footy season is heating up as the Western Bulldogs face off Brisbane Lions at Mars Stadium in Ballarat.

The game will kick off at 1.45pm.

Before you travel

We encourage you to register your myki so we can contact you if you've travelled on a public transport service identified as a COVID-19 site. Register your myki now- it's quick and easy.

You must wear a fitted face mask covering your nose and mouth on public transport and ensure you wear it for your entire journey. It's also strongly recommended you wear a face mask when you cannot maintain 1.5 metres distance from other people, such as at busy stations and stops.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Regional Trains

Ballarat/Wendouree line

Trains will run to a normal Saturday timetable with no additional services.

A shuttle bus will operate between Ballarat Station and Mars Stadium before and after the match.

Ballarat shuttle bus

Getting to Mars Stadium

From 11.30am, a shuttle bus will leave from Ballarat Station Bus Terminal and travel to Mars Stadium.

Getting to Ballarat Station

From 3pm until approximately 5.30pm, a shuttle bus will leave from Mars Stadium and drop passengers off in Sturt Street (opposite the Ballarat Town Hall) and Lydiard St North (across from the train station).
